Definition.WordDefinition: Brent, AL (city, FIPS 9136) Location: 32.94227 N, 87.17622 W Population (1990): 2776 (1103 housing units) Area: 21.2 sq km (land), 0.0 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 35034 Brent, FL (CDP, FIPS 8300) Location: 30.47377 N, 87.25174 W Population (1990): 21624 (7838 housing units) Area: 27.2 sq km (land), 0.2 sq km (water)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Brent \Brent\, Brant \Brant\, a. [AS. brant; akin to Dan. brat, Icel. brattr, steep.] 1. Steep; high. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Grapes grow on the brant rocks so wonderfully that ye will marvel how any man dare climb up to them. --Ascham. [1913 Webster]
2. Smooth; unwrinkled. [Scot.] [1913 Webster]
Your bonnie brow was brent. --Burns. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bren \Bren\, Brenne \Bren"ne\, v. t. & i. [imp. & p. p. {Brent} (?); p. pr. & vb. n. {Brenning}.] [See {Burn}.] To burn. [Obs.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
Consuming fire brent his shearing house or stall. --W. Browne. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Brent \Brent\, imp. & p. p. of {Bren}. Burnt. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Brent \Brent\, n. [Cf. {Brant}.] A brant. See {Brant}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Brant \Brant\ (br[a^]nt), n. [Cf.{Brand goose}, {Brent}, {Brenicle}.] (Zo["o]l.) A species of wild goose ({Branta bernicla}) -- called also {brent} and {brand goose}. The name is also applied to other related species. [1913 Webster]
brent n : small dark geese that breed in the north and migrate southward [syn: {brant}, {brant goose}, {brent goose}]
